channel.title: Posts on The Dax Shepherd
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on The Dax Shepherd

item.title: Using Hugo and Github Pages for my blog
item.description: I would like to say that this blog has been relaunched on Github using Hugo. But if something never launched in the first place I am not sure it can be relaunched. I initially had a WordPress blog on SiteGround. It never made it out of test. But I did learn a lot about deploying WordPress and the different plugins. It did come in handy when my work started using WordPress for the company site.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: This article is to test out the syntax highlighting for DAX code using Prism. It also is to test out using tags and categories.

item.title: Defining Measures in DAX Studio
item.description: After a period of not defining measures in DAX Studio, I seem to make the same two mistakes. The first error occurs when I try to run the following code to define a measure in a query: DEFINE MEASURE [UnitPrice] = SUM('Sales'[Unit Price]) EVALUATE CALCULATE([UnitPrice]) This generates the following error: The syntax for ‘=’ is incorrect. . The issue lies in not including the table name before the measure name.

item.title: Font Test
item.description: My name is Jason Romans and I work on the Microsoft business intelligence stack.
